item.title: Overview
item.description: Data Illustrateur’s interface consists of five components: Tool Bar, which provides selection tools, drawing tools, and action buttons Canvas, where you select, draw and manipulate items Data Panel, where you can import and see data tables Layers Panel, which shows items (e.g., shapes, groups, axes and legends) and their organizations in the canvas Property Inspector, which shows properties of selected items, and provides controls to change or bind data to properties

item.title: Export and Save
item.description: You can export your work as an SVG file, and embed it in a webpage or open it in other vector editors. To export as SVG, use the “Export” button in the Tool Bar. You can also save your work in a file with the “msc” extension on your computer, and open it later using Data Illustrateur. To do so, use the “Save” and “Open” buttons in the Tool Bar.

item.title: Zoom and Pan
item.description: You can zoom in on the canvas by pressing Ctrl + “+” keys (Windows) or Cmd + “+” keys (Mac), and zoom out on the canvas by pressing Ctrl + “-” keys (Windows) or Cmd + “-” keys (Mac). To pan the canvas, scroll using the mouse or the touchpad. To set the canvas position and size to the default values, press Ctrl + “0” keys (Windows) or Cmd + “0” keys (Mac).
